title: InfoDisent: Explainability of Image Classification Models by Information Disentanglement
details: Ł Struski, J Tabor - arXiv preprint arXiv:2409.10329, 2024
abstract: Understanding the decisions made by image classification networks is a critical area of research in deep learning. This task is traditionally divided into two distinct approaches: post-hoc methods and intrinsic methods. Post-hoc methods, such as …

title: RealDiff: Real-world 3D Shape Completion using Self-Supervised Diffusion Models
details: BM Öcal, M Tatarchenko, S Karaoglu, T Gevers - arXiv preprint arXiv:2409.10180, 2024
abstract: Point cloud completion aims to recover the complete 3D shape of an object from partial observations. While approaches relying on synthetic shape priors achieved promising results in this domain, their applicability and generalizability to real-world …

title: VAE Explainer: Supplement Learning Variational Autoencoders with Interactive Visualization
details: D Bertucci, A Endert - arXiv preprint arXiv:2409.09011, 2024
abstract: Variational Autoencoders are widespread in Machine Learning, but are typically explained with dense math notation or static code examples. This paper presents VAE Explainer, an interactive Variational Autoencoder running in the browser to …

title: Scores as Actions: a framework of fine-tuning diffusion models by continuous-time reinforcement learning
details: H Zhao, H Chen, J Zhang, DD Yao, W Tang - arXiv preprint arXiv:2409.08400, 2024
abstract: Reinforcement Learning from human feedback (RLHF) has been shown a promising direction for aligning generative models with human intent and has also been explored in recent works for alignment of diffusion generative models. In this work …
